name: Jivdhan Fort
difficulty: Hard (technical, steep climbs, requires ropes and experienced trekking skills)
description: Jivdhan Fort is a historic hill fort famous for its challenging and technical trek involving steep rock-cut stairways, vertical rock faces, and narrow ledges requiring safety gear and expert navigation. It offers spectacular views of the Sahyadri range and is culturally important for its Maratha history. The fort is part of the Matheran range and is a favorite for adventure trekkers seeking a thrilling wild experience.

startingPoint.name: Ghatghar Village
startingPoint.description: Ghatghar village serves as the main base point for the Jivdhan Fort trek. The route from here involves steep forest trails leading to the fort’s vertical approach. Facilities are limited, so preparation is necessary.

networkAvailability.emergencyContact: Dial 108 or 112 when network available; inform local contacts before trekking

restaurants: Home-cooked meals arranged via local guides or homestays

waterSources: Limited water sources on trek; carry 3+ liters of drinking water
Rock pools/cisterns may have water; treat before use
foodOptions: No food stalls on trek; carry high energy compact food

facilities: Natural caves and rock shelters provide basic shelter
No formal food or water stalls
recommendations: Carry sufficient food and water for the entire trek

permits.entry: Free entry; night stay and camping advised only after informing locals
permits.timings: Entry allowed any time; start trekking early due to technical difficulty

precautions: Only experienced trekkers with safety equipment should attempt
Trek with local guides familiar with terrain
Wear good trekking shoes with grip
Use ropes and harness where applicable

monsoon.conditions: Heavy rain, fog, slippery rocks, leeches; very dangerous weather conditions
monsoon.recommendation: Avoid trekking during monsoon season to prevent accidents

winter.conditions: Clear, cool, ideal visibility and conditions for trekking
winter.recommendation: Best season for trekking Jivdhan Fort

summer.conditions: Hot and dry on trail; water scarcity is common
summer.recommendation: Start very early; carry sufficient water

trekRoute.difficulty: Hard; technical with rope sections and climbing ladders

waypoints.description: Shaded forest path leading to base of rock face

waypoints.name: Vertical Rock Climb and Ladders
waypoints.description: Technical ascent involving ropes and metal ladders
